page.title: 02ENVIRONMENT OF HOLYMOORSIDE
page.content:
Very little of the area around Holymoorside is untouched by{Man.}The main feature of the landscape is the Hipper valley. The{River Hipper}starts on{Hipper Sick}and flows eastwards to Chesterfield. As the river reaches Holymoorside it is in a deep valley. On the the southern flank there are extensive man-made plantations. To the north are the bracken and heather slopes of Holy Moor. Just east of the village the valley widens, with very gentle slopes.
Around Holymoorside there are many interesting wild plants.{Bluebells}and {violets}are common. Less common is the {Hoary Plantain.}There are many bog plants in the area; for example the {Bog Stitchwort}and{Lousewort.
